Award.AbstractNarration: The Carnegie-Rochester Conference on Public Policy is designed to foster research and discussion of major policy issues by economists from academia and policymaking organizations. The conference has three goals. First, to stimulate policy relevance in theoretical and empirical research in economic science. Second, to encourage the interchange of scientific ideas among analysts with different approaches. Third, to develop greater understanding among academic researchers of the multiple factors that make up the economic policy environment. The result is that the conference brings together a diverse audience and encourages academic researchers to focus on problems that are of importance for economic policy. Conference attendees include participants from US and foreign central banks and international agencies as well as promising young scholars. The conference papers and formal discussions are published annually and are widely distributed in the policy making community.

Award Number:  1061740

Project Title:  Carnegie-NYU-Rochester Conference on Public Policy 

Report Type:  Project Outcomes Report

PI:  Thomas Cooley 

Awardee:  New York University 

Program Officer Name:  Nancy A. Lutz 

Program Officer Email:  nlutz@nsf.gov

Program Officer Phone Number:  (703) 292-7280

 

January 17, 2017

 

The Carnegie-NYU-Rochester Conference on Public Policy has been held twice per year since the beginning of this award, January 1, 2011, with approximately 50 participants at each of the twelve conferences.  The dates, locations and topics are listed below.  The six papers plus discussants’ comments from each conference are published in the Journal of Monetary Economics.

 

Conference Date:  April 15-16, 2011 (Stern School, New York University)

Topic:  “Advances in Labor Market Dynamics”

 

Conference Date:  November 11-12, 2011 (Tepper School, Carnegie Mellon University)

Topic:  “Robust Macroeconomic Policy”

 

Conference Date:  April 27-28, 2012 (Simon School, University of Rochester)

Topic:  “Globalization and the Business Cycle”

 

Conference Date:  November 9-10, 2012 (Tepper School, Carnegie Mellon University) 

Topic:  “Aggregate Implications of Local Public Finance”

 

Conference Date:  April 19-20, 2013 (Stern School, New York University)

Topic:  “Fiscal and Monetary Policy in the Presence of Debt”

 

Conference Date:  November 15-16, 2013 (Tepper School, Carnegie Mellon University)

Topic:  “A Century of Money, Banking, and Financial Instability”

 

Conference Date:  April 24-26, 2014 (Simon School, Rochester University)

Topic:  “Uncertainty and the Macroeconomy”

 

Conference Date:  November 14-15, 2014 (Tepper School, Carnegie Mellon University)

Topic:  “Monetary Policy: An Unprecedented Predicament”

 

Conference Date:  April 24-25, 2015 (Stern School, New York University)

Topic:  “Inequality, Institutions, and Redistribution”

 

Conference Date:  November 13-14, 2015 (Tepper School, Carnegie Mellon University)

Topic:  “Political Economy, Public Policy, and Financial Markets”

 

Conference Date:  April 8-9, 2016 (Simon School, Rochester University)

Topic:  “Globalization since the Crisis”

 

Conference Date:  November 11-12, 2016 (Tepper School, Carnegie Mellon University)

Topic:  “The Macroeconomics of Liquidity in Capital Markets and the Corporate Sector”
